intro: Ardisia guanacastensis, commonly known as the Guanacaste ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly found in the tropical regions of Costa Rica and Panama. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy dark green surface. The flowers are small, white or pale pink, and are followed by bright red berries that are attractive to birds.
